title: Fundamental Plane and Merger Scenario
items.abstract: <jats:p>The Fundamental Plane (FP) is one of the most important universal relations in early type galaxies because it contains valuable information about the formative and evolutionary process of galaxies (Djorgovski & Davis 1987, Dressler et al. 1987). The commonly used form of the scaling relation in the FP is described as <jats:italic>R</jats:italic><jats:sub>e</jats:sub> = σ<jats:sup><jats:italic>A</jats:italic></jats:sup><jats:italic>I</jats:italic><jats:sup><jats:italic>B</jats:italic></jats:sup>, where <jats:italic>R</jats:italic><jats:sub>e</jats:sub>, σ, and <jats:italic>I</jats:italic> are effective radius, central velocity dispersion, and mean surface brightness of elliptical galaxies, respectively. The exponents <jats:italic>A, B</jats:italic> are considered to be 1.56 ± 0.07 and −0.94 ± 0.09 in the FP derived by <jats:italic>K</jats:italic> band photometry, respectively, and these values deviate significantly from the values <jats:italic>A</jats:italic> = 2.0 and <jats:italic>B</jats:italic> = −1.0 expected from virial theorem (Pahre et al. 1995; Djorgovski, Pahre, & de Carvalho 1996). This apparent deviation requires that the ratio of dynamical mass (<jats:italic>M</jats:italic>) to luminosity of elliptical galaxies (<jats:italic>L</jats:italic>) depends on <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> as <jats:italic>M</jats:italic>/<jats:italic>L</jats:italic> ∝ <jats:italic>M</jats:italic><jats:sup>α</jats:sup> (α = 0.12 ± 0.03 for <jats:italic>K</jats:italic> band). Possible interpretations for the required dependence of <jats:italic>M</jats:italic>/<jats:italic>L</jats:italic> on <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> are generally considered to be divided into the following two. One is that the required dependence of <jats:italic>M</jats:italic>/<jats:italic>L</jats:italic> on <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> results from the fact that the mean stellar age and metalicity of elliptical galaxies depend systematically on <jats:italic>M</jats:italic>. The other is that the required dependence reflects the <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> dependence of structural and kinematical properties of elliptical galaxies (“nonhomology”). Although we should not neglect the importance of stellar populations in generating the <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> dependence of the <jats:italic>M</jats:italic>/<jats:italic>L</jats:italic> (Renzini & Ciotti 1993), we here consider that the origin of the required <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> dependence of <jats:italic>M</jats:italic>/<jats:italic>L</jats:italic> is closely associated with the structural and kinematical properties dependent on <jats:italic>M</jats:italic> or <jats:italic>L</jats:italic> in elliptical galaxies.</jats:p>
